snippet: With the family of the former dictator Ferdinand Marcos politically ascendant, efforts to pursue assets connected to his leadership days have faltered.
abstract: Efforts by Philippines government to recover allegedly ill-gotten wealth of country's former dictator Ferdinand E Marcos have faltered, leading chairman of commission leading efforts to recommend that commission be abolished; committee's failure to pursue estimated $10 billion plundered from country has been complicated by fact that members of Marcos family have taken prominent political posts.
lead_paragraph: With the family of the former dictator Ferdinand Marcos politically ascendant, efforts to pursue assets connected to his leadership days have faltered.

headline.seo: Philippines May Curb Pursuit of Marcos’s Wealth
headline.main: Philippines May Curb the Pursuit of Marcos’s Wealth
headline.print_headline: Philippines May Curb the Pursuit of Marcos’s Wealth
